definitions.definition: identify (someone or something) from having encountered them before; know again.
examples: I recognized her when her wig fell off

definitions.definition: identify from knowledge of appearance or character.
examples: Pat is very good at recognizing wildflowers
synonyms: recollect; know by sight "Hannah recognized him at once"

definitions.definition: (of a computer or other machine) automatically identify and respond correctly to (a sound, printed character, etc.).
acknowledge the existence, validity, or legality of.
examples: the defense is recognized in Mexican law
synonyms: appreciate; formalbe cognizant of "they recognized Alan's ability"officially approve

definitions.definition: officially regard (a qualification) as valid or proper.
examples: these qualifications are recognized by the Department of Education

definitions.definition: grant diplomatic recognition to (a country or government).
examples: they were refusing to recognize the puppet regime

definitions.definition: show official appreciation of; reward formally.
examples: his work was recognized by an honorary degree from Georgetown University
synonyms: commend "the board recognized their hard work"

definitions.definition: (of a person presiding at a meeting or debate) call on (someone) to speak.
